New Records: This is another T20I series win for India at home, 16 in a row now. They've not lost one since 2019.
Key Match Events: India defeated Bangladesh in the second T20I match by 86 runs at Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium on 9 October, clinching the series by 2-0.
Nitish Reddy becomes 'Player of the Match' for scoring 74 runs and 2 wickets.
India scored 221/9 in 20 overs and gave a target of 222 runs for Bangladesh to chase.
For India, Nitish Kumar Reddy (74) and Rinku Singh (53) scored their half-centuries.
For Bangladesh, Rishad Hossain took three wickets, and Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, and Tanzim Hasan Sakib each took two wickets.
Mahmudullah (41) scored the highest runs for Bangladesh.
India's Varun Chakravarthy and Nitish Reddy picked two wickets each.
Arshdeep Singh, Washington Sundar, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Yadav, and Riyan Parag clinched one wicket each.
Pre-Game Insights: After losing the toss and being asked to bat first, India dominated Bangladeshi bowlers in the second T20I match at Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium on 9 October.
Defeating the Najmul Hossain Shanto-led Bangladesh by 7 wickets in the first T20I at Gwalior on 6 October, Suryakumar Yadav and Co. looked to seal the three-match series on Wednesday.
In the first T20I match, India decided to hand debut caps to Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy in Gwalior.
Post-Match Reflections: India skipper Suryakumar Yadav said, 'I wanted that situation, wanted my batters (5,6,7) in that situation. Happy for both (Rinku and Nitish) of them. They batted exactly the way I wanted. You got to go out there and express. Just the jersey changes, rest remaining remains the same. I wanted to see what different bowlers can do in different situations. Can they give me the difficult overs. Sometimes Hardik won't bowl, sometimes Washington Sunday won't bowl. Wanted to see what the guys had in store, really happy with it. It was his day, I thought let him enjoy and make it large.'

Bangladesh skipper Nazmul Hossain Shanto said, 'I think we made the same mistakes (like the first game), not a good thing as a team. We need to improve. I think it was a good decision (to bowl). They batted well after the first 6-7 overs, we didn't execute our plans after that. Need to take responsibilities as batsmen, we got to believe in ourselves. The way our bowlers bowled, they were impressive, but we couldn't take wickets in the middle overs like I said.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The third T20I match will be played in Hyderabad on October 12.
